Description: The source of the input nucleic molecule
Valid Values: Single Cell, Bulk Cell, Single Nucleus, Bulk Nuclei

Description: The disassociation method used for scRNASeq assays
Process which results in the creation of a library from fragments of DNA using cloning vectors or oligonucleotides with the role of adaptors [OBI_0000711]
The specific fraction of biological macromolecule from which the sequencing library is derived, e.g. polyA RNA
The end of the cDNA molecule that is preferentially sequenced, e.g. 3/5 prime tag/end or the full length transcript

A DNA synthesis process that uses RNA as the initial template for synthesis of DNA, but which also includes an RNase activity to remove the RNA strand of an RNA-DNA heteroduplex produced by the RNA-dependent synthesis step and use of the initial DNA strand as a template for DNA synthesis. [GO_0001171]

Requires:
cDNA Read, cDNA Offset,
cDNA Size
Properties:
cDNA Read, cDNA Offset,
cDNA Size

Description: Unique molecular identifier; added at cell isolation or library construction step. Determines which transcript molecule the read originated from.

Requires: UMI Barcode Read, UMI Barcode Offset, UMI Barcode Length, Median UMIs per Cell Number
Properties: UMI Barcode Read, UMI Barcode Offset, UMI Barcode Length, Median UMIs per Cell Number

Description: Unique cell identifier. Determines which cell the read originated from

Requires: Cell Barcode Read, Cell Barcode Offset, Cell Barcode Length, Valid Barcodes Cell Number
Properties: Cell Barcode Read, Cell Barcode Offset, Cell Barcode Length, Valid Barcodes Cell Number

Description: An oligo to which new deoxyribonucleotides can be added by DNA polymerase [SO_0000112]. The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. oligo-dT or random primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input e.g. enriched for mRNA
A set of known synthetic RNA molecules with known sequence that are added to the cell lysis mix
Valid Values: ERCC, Other Spike In, No Spike In

Description: The External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) spike in set is commonly used in single-cell experiments for normalization
The final concentration or dilution (for commercial sets) of the spike in mix [PMID:21816910]
A platform is an object_aggregate that is the set of instruments and software needed to perform a process [OBI_0000050]
Valid Values: Illumina Next Seq 500, Illumina Next Seq 2500

Description: A common term for all files belonging to the same cell or library. We suggest to use a stable sample accession from a biosample archive like BioSamples.
Median number of genes detected per cell.
